item.title: Graph Laplacians
item.description: Laplacian is a useful representation of graphs. The unnormalized Laplacian is $$ \mathbf L = \mathbf D - \mathbf A, $$ where $\mathbf A$ is the adjacency matrix Graph Adjacency Matrix A graph $\mathcal G$ can be represented with an adjacency matrix $\mathbf A$.
